channel.title: Recovery on Everyday Linux
channel.description: Recent content in Recovery on Everyday Linux

item.title: Restore Files from rm
item.description: Restore files from rm I wanted to type: $ rm *.retry Instead I accidentally typed: $ rm * .retry That wiped out the four or five files I had been working on the last two days. I was lucky it wasn’t more. I was lucky I didn’t care about the binary data I had in the folder. It took a little time and work, but in the end, I was able to find all the documents.
